item.description:
fn:identity: accept 2 arguments, ignore second

Apart from id, Haskell has const, which accepts 2 arguments, but only returns the first. Thanks to the introduction of default arguments, itâ€™s straightforward to extend fn:identity to be able to accept 2 arguments:

fn:identity(
  $input    as item()*,
  $ignored  as item()*  := ()
) as item()*
